awd_titl_txt: A New Ultracentrifuge to Upgrade Undergraduate Studies in   Cellular and Molecular Biology
awd_abstract_narration: To assist the Department of Biology to more fully develop laboratories          in Cellular and Molecular Biology, NSF is providing funds for the               addition of an ultracentrifuge with three rotors.  A major trend in             biology today is the understanding of biological phenomena in these two         areas.  This equipment enables students in the Cell Biology course to           perform sophisticated experiments dealing with the isolation of cellular        organelles and DNA.                                                                                                                                             The addition of an ultracentrifuge to the equipment already available in        the laboratories through the combined efforts of the State of Michigan          and two major industrial firms in the community allows students in the          Molecular Biology course to do all of the critical techniques involved          in the area of genetic engineering.
